text: Working for me too... Thanks <@U2H3TT8F2>
<@U01QVR44MEY> do you have any insights about this?

Hey! I have a custom property for customers which is a multi choise type with predefined values. So i can set this by adding
```"my_property" => "my_value"```
to the api request. but how could i unset a property?
What do you mean unset ?
you want to put in "my_property" a Null value ?

no on the HubSpot side the my_property is a multi checkbox thing. so you can check certain values there and also uncheck them. so with my api call I am able to check a checkbox but how could I uncheck a a checkbox?
:raised_hands:
Thanks :pray:
thanks y’all. I mean this from the bottom of my heart when I say, “you truly are a great arsonist and firefighter” :stuck_out_tongue:
I can’t take the credit on this fix, this one goes to <@U024L8W0MB6> :sprocket:

Hi i'm looking for some help to display filtered custom object properties on a webpage, I have done it by hardcoding a filter into the module but would like to give filtering options on the front end of the module to allow the user to decide which information they want to be displayed within that specific module so that it doesn't have to be hard coded everytime. Thanks
And you do have a contact with the id of 101 right?
<@UDU6KEBFB> can you provide me with the portal id that this is for above? You can send it via DM if you want.
Is it possible you can share your code example Please? I'm having a lot of difficulties creating a quote through custom code. Thanks <@U05HJMT2BK5>
yes of course( 101 is an example i change it with the right id )
use a blank value `""`  to reset the selection.
So you are suggesting to not using the SDK( HubSpot Client ) ?
yeah definitely don't use the SDK, i've found it to be pretty unreliable
<https://HubSpotdev.slack.com/archives/C2YHAHB6K/p1681417307273069>
Sorry for surfacing this, trying my luck again, and asking something new while at it: is there a way to get official support in these matters, or my only hope is with the community? Thanks :pray:

Hey, we are using our own consent banner on a SPA. When the user declines we just call `hsp.push(["revokeCookieConsent"])` and this is working well ! But with a refresh or on another session, the cookies appear again. Any idea why and if there are other way to do it ?

You can create folders in the file manager with `@` in the folder name via API. This causes file urls in that folder to 404.

cc <@UD53A9UUR>
Note I assume the @ is the problem as you are not allowed to put the @ symbol in a folder name from within the HubSpot interface.
And does not seem to affect private / share internal link, only public links(?)
+ symbol seems to cause issues too but it’s allowed in the HubSpot interface
Nvm I have no idea what’s going on. Seems the url visibility is delayed or something.
:open_mouth: thank you <@U01QVR44MEY>
of course <@U018962HD47>

Hi

I am trying to create a contact over the API using Nodejs
I got this error
403 - {"status":"error","message":"This hapikey ([SECRET]) does not have proper permissions! (requires all of [contacts-write])","correlationId":"07517635-f12b-49c3-9ed8-154843f11750"}
<@U02PP69P9T8> is the `objectId` above a single deals ID or is this is just ID of the deals object as a whole?
it is the hs_object_id of a specific deal record
as mentioned here, it doesnt work either: <https://HubSpotdev.slack.com/archives/C2YHAHB6K/p1690402863897829?thread_ts=1689798119.147999&cid=C2YHAHB6K>
thanks for digging :slightly_smiling_face:
does it work for other object types?
